conclusion: Analyze forces on object A to find height it rises and spring constant k2 using equilibrium and Hooke's law.
System with two springs and a pulley; Spring B is vertical, Spring C is horizontal, mass of A is 2 kg, spring constant of B is 200 N/m, endpoint of C moves 60 cm.
Initially, object A is at rest, springs not deformed, tension in spring B is zero.
When endpoint of spring C is pulled to position b, tension in spring B equals weight of A.
Tension in spring B is 19.6 N when stretched by x meters.
Using Hooke's law for spring B, 19.6 = 200x, so x = 0.098 meters.
Height h that A rises is given by h = x.
Horizontal displacement of right endpoint of spring C is ab = 0.6 meters.
Force in spring C is k2 * 0.6.
Force equals difference between weight of A and tension in spring B: 19.6 - 19.6 * 0.098 = 0.6 * k2.
Height A rises is h = 0.098 meters, spring constant k2 is 200 N/m.
